meanings.sent1: The librarian whishted the noisy students in the library.
meanings.sent2: She whishted her little brother to stop talking during the movie.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat whishted the dog by sneaking up behind it.
meanings.sent4: The falling snow whishted the world into a peaceful stillness.
meanings.sent5: The teacher whishted the class with a stern look, silencing them instantly.

meanings.sent1: The mother whishted her baby to sleep with a gentle lullaby.
meanings.sent2: He quickly whishted his friend as they entered the quiet library.
meanings.sent3: The magician whishted the audience before performing his grand trick.
meanings.sent4: The wind whishted through the trees, creating a calming sound.
meanings.sent5: She whishted the noisy crowd with a wave of her hand, demanding attention.

meanings.sent1: The whishted of the leaves in the breeze was soothing.
meanings.sent2: She heard a faint whishted coming from the old house.
meanings.sent3: The child's giggle had a playful whishted to it.
meanings.sent4: The distant whishted of the waves carried through the night.
meanings.sent5: The whishted of the falling rain on the roof was a lullaby to her ears.
